snippet: Thousands of New York employees signed up for pensions over the last several weeks to lock in generous retirement benefits before state cuts took effect on Sunday.
abstract: Thousands of New York State public employees have rushed to sign up for pensions, seeking to lock in generous retirement benefits before cuts approved by the State Legislature took effect on April 1.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and KATE TAYLOR
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan reported from Albany, and Kate Taylor from New York.

lead_paragraph: Thousands of New York employees signed up for pensions over the last several weeks to lock in generous retirement benefits before state cuts took effect on Sunday.

headline.seo: New York Workers Rushed to Join Pensions Before Cutbacks
headline.main: State Public Workers Rushed to Join Pensions Before Cutbacks
headline.print_headline: Public Workers Rushed to Join Pensions Before Albany’s Cutbacks Took Effect
